course_title: Topics in Chinese Studies: The Stories of Chinese Objects
class_notes:
(Same as EAS 385 )  This class contains synchronous and asynchronous material. It will meet synchronously at the listed day and time, with all other content to be completed asynchronously.


This course studies Chinese culture and history through a close examination of significant and representative artifacts, including paintings, calligraphies, steles, porcelains, bronze vessels, costumes, sculptures, architectures, and many more. Multiple methodologies from various disciplines including art history, archeology, literary criticism, and cultural analysis will be applied to illustrate a tapestry of ideas, tastes, craftsmanship, and technologies that shape Chinese social life.
course_description: Study of Chinese language, literature, thought or culture, alone or in conjunction with other literary or cultural trends. Topics to be announced in advance.
sections: Class Nbr: 3626, Section #: 2, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 6-7:15p, Instructor: G. Chen, Status: Open
